introduction.title: S1000D Procedure Document
introduction.para: The following is an S1000D procedure for lubricating a bicycle chain. This document provides step-by-step instructions on how to apply penetrating lubricant and lubricate the chain.

personnel.item: One mechanic with knowledge of bicycle maintenance

supplies.item: ACME sticky lube 52B (KZ222, LL-007) for wet conditions
AECMA Heavy duty Oil 1988 (B6865, HD1988) for dry conditions

safety-requirements.item: Wear protective gloves when handling lubricants
Avoid getting lubricant on skin or eyes
If swallowed, seek immediate medical attention

step.title: Apply Penetrating Lubricant
step.para: Apply penetrating lubricant to moving parts of the bicycle:
step.item: Brake lever pivots (refer to Brake Lever Pivots)

step.title: Lubricate the Chain
step.item: Make sure the chain is clean and dry.
Put floor covering under the chain to catch any excess lubricant.
Apply lubricant to each roller of the chain (refer to Chain Lubrication)
step.para: For dry conditions, use AECMA Heavy duty Oil 1988. For wet conditions, use ACME sticky lube 52B. Apply a small quantity of lubricant to each roller.

step.title: Check Lubricated Parts
step.para: Check the following parts and clean any excess lubricant:

closing-requirements.para: No specific closing requirements are necessary for this procedure.
